title: Shubman Gill thwarts Bangladesh as India win Champions Trophy opener
description: Bangladesh 228, India 231-4; India win by six wicketsGill hits unbeaten century, Shami shines with ballShubman Gill struck an unbeaten century after Mohammed Shami took five wickets as India cruised to a six-wicket win over Bangladesh in their Champions Trophy opener in Dubai.Having slipped to 35 for five after choosing to bat, Bangladesh fought back to make 228 with Towhid Hridoy making 100 and Jaker Ali contributing 68, the pair sharing a sixth-wicket stand of 154. author: PA Media
excerpt: Shubman Gill hit an unbeaten century as India beat Bangladesh by six wickets in their Champions Trophy opener in Dubai
text: Shubman Gill struck an unbeaten century after Mohammed Shami took five wickets as India cruised to a six-wicket win over Bangladesh in their Champions Trophy opener in Dubai.Having slipped to 35 for five after choosing to bat, Bangladesh fought back to make 228 with Towhid Hridoy making 100 and Jaker Ali contributing 68, the pair sharing a sixth-wicket stand of 154.Shami took five for 53 and Axar Patel missed out on a hat-trick after Rohit Sharma dropped a simple catch at slip from the third ball, having dismissed Tanzid Hasan and Mushfiqur Rahim.Gill led the way in the chase, taking his side home in the 47th over with 101 from 129 deliveries, his eighth one-day international century, which included nine fours and two sixes.Sharma made 41 in a 69-run opening stand with Gill before Virat Kohli, Shreyas Iyer and Patel came and went, with KL Rahul hitting an unbeaten 41 after he was dropped on nine.
html:
Shubman Gill struck an unbeaten century after Mohammed Shami took five wickets as India cruised to a six-wicket win over Bangladesh in their Champions Trophy opener in Dubai.

Having slipped to 35 for five after choosing to bat, Bangladesh fought back to make 228 with Towhid Hridoy making 100 and Jaker Ali contributing 68, the pair sharing a sixth-wicket stand of 154.

Shami took five for 53 and Axar Patel missed out on a hat-trick after Rohit Sharma dropped a simple catch at slip from the third ball, having dismissed Tanzid Hasan and Mushfiqur Rahim.

Gill led the way in the chase, taking his side home in the 47th over with 101 from 129 deliveries, his eighth one-day international century, which included nine fours and two sixes.

Sharma made 41 in a 69-run opening stand with Gill before Virat Kohli, Shreyas Iyer and Patel came and went, with KL Rahul hitting an unbeaten 41 after he was dropped on nine.
